Articles.Content:
Just thought I\'d add a bunch of fuel tanks together and evidently it was enough to get to the mun! Almost ran out of fuel on the way down as you can see. Landing on a little hill unfortunately, but I thought it made for a pretty cool crash site! I believe I had 124 fuel tanks on that guy. If I had made a little return module on top it might have actually been able to make it home at that angle!

I\'ll probably try and visit the wreckage with one of my more... normal ships sometime.

You might want to visit it with your very next ship. I find that debris that has landed seems to get removed after a while. I\'m not sure if its based on elapsed time, or if you have to do like 10 launches, but stuff does go away. I\'ve landed twice on the Mun since the last update wiped my persistence with the re-install, and both of the lander pods I left behind have vanished. Its a nice feature to clean up clutter (I wish orbiting debris would blow up too, or maybe it does and I don\'t know yet because its all from the last two flights), but it means your crash site won\'t be there forever.
Nice job. You got a pic of that on the launch pad?

Now that\'s a crash site and a half!

Good job on surviving it though those Kerbals might want a lift home at some point!
Send a rescue mission ! Not to save them, only to build a bigger crash site

I find that debris that has landed seems to get removed after a while. I\'m not sure if its based on elapsed time, or if you have to do like 10 launches, but stuff does go away.

Change the Max. Debris in the Options menu to \'Infinite\'

Anyway, nice crash...
